field.label: Start Delay
field.help: On system boot wait before Monit starts checking services.

field.label: Mail Server Address
field.help: Comma-separated list of SMTP servers for alert delivery.

field.label: Mail Server Port
field.help: The port of the mail server. Typically 465 for SSL or 25 for TLS and non secure connections.

field.label: Mail Server Username
field.help: The username for mail server authentication.

field.label: Mail Server Password
field.help: The password for mail server authentication.

field.label: Mail Server SSL Connection
field.help: Enable encryption for mail server communication.

field.label: SSL Version
field.help: Set the SSL version to use. In AUTO mode, only TLS is used.

field.label: Verify SSL certificates
field.help: Enable or disable SSL server certificate verification.

field.label: Log File
field.help: The log file of the Monit process. This can be the keyword syslog or the path to a file.

field.label: State File
field.help: The state file of the Monit process.

field.label: Eventqueue Path
field.help: The path to the eventqueue directory.

field.label: Monit HTTPD Port
field.help: The listen port of the Monit httpd service.

field.label: Monit HTTPD Access List
field.help:
The username:password or host/network etc. for accessing the Monit httpd service.
See Monit Authentication

field.label: M/Monit URL
field.help:
The M/Monit URL.
https://user:pass@192.168.1.10:8443/collector
If you want to control Monit services from your M/Monit instance you have to configure the Monit Port too and add corresponding firewall rules as well.

field.label: M/Monit Register Credentials
field.help: Automatically register in M/Monit by sending Monit credentials (see Monit Access List above).
